<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.

It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_param_value:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
get_param_value (const char *param_name, const char *param_tail,
                 const char *next_param, unsigned int *param_value)
{
  const char *value_str;
  size_t digits;
  if (0 != param_tail[0])
  {
    if ('=' != param_tail[0])
      value_str = param_tail;
    else
      value_str = param_tail + 1;
  }
  else
    value_str = next_param;

  if (NULL != value_str)
    digits = mhd_tool_str_to_uint (value_str, param_value);
  else
    digits = 0;

  if ((0 == digits) || (0 != value_str[digits]))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' is not followed by valid number.\n",
             param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }

  if (0 != param_tail[0])
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR;

  return PERF_RPL_PARAM_STR_PLUS_NEXT;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No controlling expression in this function is an invariant constant. Each conditional depends on function inputs or computed values, so none appear to violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3: 

- if (0 != param_tail[0]) and the nested if ('=' != param_tail[0]) depend on the runtime contents of param_tail. They are not compile-time constants.
- value_str is assigned from param_tail, param_tail + 1, or next_param; the test if (NULL != value_str) depends on those inputs and the preceding assignment, so it is not invariant.
- digits is computed by mhd_tool_str_to_uint (or set to 0 when value_str is NULL); the combined condition if ((0 == digits) || (0 != value_str[digits])) depends on that runtime result (and short-circuit evaluation prevents dereference when value_str is NULL and digits == 0).
- The final if (0 != param_tail[0]) again depends on param_tail contents and is not a constant expression.

Also, there are no loops with constant controlling expressions (no infinite-loop or do-while constant-false exceptions apply). Therefore there are no fragments that need further investigation for Rule 14.3.
